generations.name: DK Series
generations.description: The original DK series (DK2, DK3) were China's first domestically produced metro cars, serving Lines 1 and 2 from the system's opening. They featured basic amenities and were gradually replaced starting in the 1990s.

generations.name: DKZ4 Series
generations.description: The DKZ4 series represented a significant modernization of Beijing's fleet, featuring improved passenger amenities and air conditioning. They primarily served Line 1.

generations.name: DKZ5 Series
generations.description: The DKZ5 series was introduced for Line 13 when it opened in 2002. These Type B cars feature a 4-car configuration suitable for the suburban line's ridership levels.

generations.name: SFM04 Series
generations.description: The SFM04 series are modern Type B cars serving Line 1. They feature LED displays, improved HVAC systems, and regenerative braking.

generations.name: SFM14 Series
generations.description: The SFM14 series serves multiple lines including Lines 4, 8, and Batong Line. These Type B cars are operated by Beijing MTR and feature modern passenger amenities.

generations.name: Type A (Line 6/14)
generations.description: Type A cars on Lines 6 and 14 are larger-capacity vehicles designed for high-volume routes. They feature 8-car consists with a capacity of nearly 2,500 passengers per train.

generations.name: Type A (Line 16/17/19)
generations.description: The newest Type A cars serve Lines 16, 17, and 19. These high-capacity trains feature modern passenger information systems and energy-efficient propulsion.

generations.name: SFM16 Automated
generations.description: The SFM16 series operates on the Yanfang Line as China's first fully automated (GoA4) domestically-developed metro trains, requiring no on-board staff.

generations.name: ART 200
generations.description: The ART 200 series was jointly developed for the Capital Airport Express. These premium trains feature luggage storage, comfortable seating, and real-time flight information displays.

generations.name: Type D Airport Express
generations.description: The Type D trains on the Daxing Airport Express are the fastest metro trains in Beijing, operating at 160 km/h. They are fully automated and feature airport-style amenities.

generations.name: S1 Maglev
generations.description: The S1 maglev trains use electromagnetic levitation technology, providing a smooth and quiet ride. This was Beijing's first maglev line and demonstrates Chinese maglev capabilities.

generations.name: Xijiao Tram
generations.description: Modern low-floor trams serving the Xijiao Line to Fragrant Hills. These articulated trams provide scenic views along the route to the western hills.
